definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

pinyin: jian4 she4 xing4 de5 pi1 ping2

sentences.english: He had meant to advise his subordinates constructively this time.
sentences.chinese: 這次他倒是打算給下級一些建設性的指示的。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid to ask for help if you need it - and don't take constructive criticism personally.
sentences.chinese: 別害怕尋求幫助，也別親自提出建設性的評論。

sentences.english: At the end of the paper, some construct…
sentences.chinese: 對如何興“利”除“弊”，提出一些建設性意見。

sentences.english: And the devices Mr Obama denounces have many constructive uses.
sentences.chinese: 而且那些奧巴馬指責的產品有許多建設性的用途。

sentences.english: Accept constructive criticism, but ignore naysayers.
sentences.chinese: 接受建設性的批評，但是忽略那些老唱反調的人。

sentences.english: The twentieth rule is that you must understand that eyewash is constructive.
sentences.chinese: 第二十條必須懂得表面文章的建設性。

sentences.english: Some criticisms are constructive and will help you find your voice.
sentences.chinese: 有些批評是很有建設性的，可以幫助你找回你自己。

sentences.english: Political repression discourages any constructive criticism.
sentences.chinese: 政治上的壓制致使少了許多有建設性的言論。

sentences.english: Therefore, listening to the students' constructive suggestions could improve teachers' performance.
sentences.chinese: 因此，聽取學生的建設性意見能夠提高教學服務的。

sentences.english: Second, full co-operation and constructive engagement with the UN.
sentences.chinese: 第二，與聯合國進行全面合作和建設性接觸。

sentences.english: Encourage individuals to bring highly-developed proposals for direct actions to the meetings.
sentences.chinese: 鼓勵個人向行動指導會議提出建設性的建議。

sentences.english: There is a difference between constructive criticism and vicious criticism.
sentences.chinese: 建設性的意見和惡毒的指責是完全不同的。

sentences.english: So then, how do you deliver constructive criticism?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，你該如何給出建設性批評呢？

sentences.english: I know that is a positive suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 我知道那是一項建設性建議。

sentences.english: It has also left most Gazans without a productive form of employment.
sentences.chinese: 它還使得大多數加沙人找不到任何建設性的工作。

sentences.english: I don't see Copsey's discussion of the topic via this review as a constructive contribution to the debate.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲科普塞的討論對於此問題有建設性的貢獻。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
